oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Different customs concerning the eating of the Porcupine. By /han=kasso (L VII.-6. 6590 rev.-6594 rev.). The people who live where the sun sets (the place where Dia!kwain and his people come from) roast and eat the porcupine on the hunting-ground, but |han=kass'o's people take the porcupine home when there are no springbok. 1) This story is found in Book VIII-6.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Lucy Lloyd |xam notebooks
oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Mode of eating porcupine
